messages.subject: Re: Wishcraft
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sher s ... totally! one of the first exercises, about thinking what your unique genius is, getting back to what you were into as a little child before the
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, KathrynJB@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 5/10/2003 11:43:38 AM Eastern Standard Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
> > Whoever recommended this book, ((((hug))))) :)
> >
> > Good stuff. I've discovered that I already have a lot of my ideal
> > life, all around me, all the time.
> >
> > Gonna go for it, now, in realizing some dreams
> >
> > thanks muchly
> >
> >
>
> Oh, I'm so glad. If you ever get a chance to attend one of Barbara
Sher's
> workshops, jump at it! She's way cool!
>
> Do you see what I mean about the connections between Wishcraft and
> unschooling?
> Kathryn
>

totally! one of the first exercises, about thinking what your unique
genius is, getting back to what you were into as a little child
before the school system knocked it out of you...wow! Makes me KNOW,
my kids are better off with me backing away and letting them do their
own thing...they will be much better off as adults, if they are
allowed to go along their path from the beginning.

It's pretty exciting, nervous making...

thanks again
HeidiC


>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Wishcraft

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/10/2003 11:43:38 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Whoever recommended this book, ((((hug))))) :)
>
> Good stuff. I've discovered that I already have a lot of my ideal
> life, all around me, all the time.
>
> Gonna go for it, now, in realizing some dreams
>
> thanks muchly
>
>

Oh, I'm so glad. If you ever get a chance to attend one of Barbara Sher's
workshops, jump at it! She's way cool!

Do you see what I mean about the connections between Wishcraft and
unschooling?
Kathryn
